steps.title: Put aged aquarium water in a clear container.
steps.content: Put aged aquarium water in a clear container. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Expose the water to the sun.
steps.content: Expose the water to the sun. Doing this takes quite a long time for the algae to bloom. [2] X Research source See the next method for something faster.

steps.title: Pluck 10 smoothly surfaced and thin leaves.
steps.content: Pluck 10 smoothly surfaced and thin leaves.

steps.title: Wash and rinse the leaves until they are clean.
steps.content: Wash and rinse the leaves until they are clean. Don't use soap!

steps.title: Put the leaves in the blender with water.
steps.content: Put the leaves in the blender with water. You can also add fish micro pellets to help the culture bloom more quickly.

steps.title: Blend the water with the leaves.
steps.content: Blend the water with the leaves. Do this for about 1 minute.

steps.title: Sieve any blended leaves and put the water in a bottle.
steps.content: Sieve any blended leaves and put the water in a bottle.

steps.title: Put the bottle under a bright light overnight so that the phytoplankton will bloom.
steps.content: Put the bottle under a bright light overnight so that the phytoplankton will bloom.

steps.title: Put the greenwater that has been sitting under a bright light overnight in the bucket.
steps.content: Put the greenwater that has been sitting under a bright light overnight in the bucket.

steps.title: Let the bucket sit under the sun.
steps.content: Let the bucket sit under the sun. In about a few days, the phytoplankton will grow.
